title.narrative: Increasing financial inclusion in Mexico by supporting female beneficiaries of Mexico’s social development programme to move from cash to digital banking channels.

description.narrative: The project will deliver a first wave of transitions to digital transfers as part of a Randomised Control Trial. It will feed into the design of a protocol that will increase the adoption of digital bank transfers for Mexico’s largest social development programme, targeting financial access and inclusion for Mexico’s poorest women. Moving to digital bank transfers mean that these beneficiaries (generally women in poverty) will avoid losses via corruption or insecurity, and receive the education to understand how to use their accounts. Which will increase their inclusion in the financial sector, helping them access other financial products in the long-term and reduce informality rates, while helping the financial services market grow sustainably across the country. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.
